name: Women's History Month and Planned Parenthood
description:
In honor of Women's History Month, Vault of Midnight will be donating the profits from sales of the amazing Bitch Planet Vol. 1 to Planned Parenthood for the entire month of March. 

Have you read Bitch Planet? If not, you have to as soon as possible. Kelly Sue Deconnick and Valentine De Landro's dystopian, sci-fi, non-compliant masterpiece has never been more urgent or prescient. 

Already have a copy? Then pick one (or a few) up as a gift and help us donate to the cause. 

Summon your inner Penny and Rolle up your sleeves! Let's do this!

name: Planer/Joiner /Drum Sander!
description: This class will introduce you to the Wood studio's 20" planer, 8" jointer and 24" drum sander. These 3 tools are great to know if doing any type of woodworking project. You will learn basic operation with an emphasis on safety. With the successful completion of this class you will be certified to use the planer and jointer and drum sander on your own.

name: Eliot Heaton & Pauline Martin
description:
Eliot Heaton, violin
Pauline Martin, piano


Eliot and Pauline present a recital featuring pieces of American influence, including a world premier of by David DiChiera.
Program
Sonatina, Opus 100 - Antonin Dvořák 
Fantasy for Violin and Piano (World Premier) - David DiChiera
Sonata for Violin and Piano - Maurice Ravel
Tzigane - Maurice Ravel
Sonata No. 3, Op. 45 in C Minor - Edvard Grieg

$30 Assigned Rows 1-2
$20 Assigned Rows 3-5
$15 General Admission
$5 Student

name: Collaborative Concert with Paul Keller At Sundown Quintet
description:
This concert will feature the renowned Paul Keller AT SUNDOWN Quintet performing a variety of jazz standards. In addition, the quintet will also perform both Jimmy McHugh's "Exactly Like You" and Andy Razaf's "Memories of You" alongside the CMSa2 Youth Orchestras, the arrangements for which were done by Paul Keller himself! The concert will also include the results of a blues and improvisation workshop that Paul Keller will be doing with the Youth Orchestras the week before. It will truly be a concert unlike any other that CMSa2 has done before!

Free admission
$10 suggested donation

name: Fireside Fun
description:
There's nothing quite as relaxing as sitting around a campfire, roasting marshmallows and swapping stories. One Sunday a month, we'll be stoking the fires here at LSNC. Bring your family, friends, camp chairs, outdoor games, and s'mores fixings. We'll provide a blazing outdoor campfire and plenty of marshmallows. This event is rain or shine (except for thunder and lightening), so come dressed for the weather.

Ages: All ages
Free

name: Open Mic and Feature: Fiona Chamness
description: Fiona Chamness is a poet, musician, and songwriter from Ann Arbor, MI. She is coauthor, with Aimée Lê, of Feral Citizens, published in 2011 by Red Beard Press.  Her poems have appeared in PANK, Muzzle, Radius, Blood Lotus, Beloit Poetry Journal, and other places, and her crown of sonnets, "Choreography for Ensemble", was awarded the 2014 Beloit Poetry Journal Prize. She has performed poetry and music in Ann Arbor, Chicago, Oberlin, Hanover, Boston, St. Louis, Berkeley, and Sevilla, Spain, and was featured in the 2010 HBO documentary Brave New Voices. She is the Short Story Advisor at the Neutral Zone.

name: Michigan Women // Girly Show
description:
Michigan Women
A Charity Concert for Alternatives for Girls

$20 General Admission
$10 Student

This evening of music will feature the Junior and Senior women of the University of Michigan Musical Theatre department. The concert will celebrate women's achievements in the field of music as the singers present songs by female composers and lyricists.
Proceeds from this concert will go to Alternatives for Girls, a charity organization based in Detroit serving homeless and high-risk girls and young women.  

Since 1987, AFG has provided critical services to the girls and young women we serve, including safe shelter, street outreach and educational support, vocational guidance, mentoring, prevention activities, and counseling. The goal is to empower the girls and young women we serve to make positive choices. For more information, visit alternativesforgirls.org.

name: Sing Happy!
description: Join us for a rousing evening of Kander & Ebb's best songs, in new, inventive arrangements and mashups, at Conor O'Neill's Irish Pub in Ann Arbor! Grab a dinner-and-a-show combo ticket for just $30, or choose to join us for the show only, for $15.00. Dinner seatings begin at 6:00pm; curtain is at 7:30pm. Performances are February 2, 3, 7, 8, 9, 14, 15, and 16.

name: Babo Juice Cleanses
description:
COLD-PRESSED JUICE CLEANSES ARE BACK!

... and just in time for the New Year! For the month of January only– get 10% off your juice cleanse and a free yoga class with Bikram Yoga West!

Book your Cleanse now with promo code JUICECLEANSEJANUARY at Store.BaboAnnArbor.com!

name: 2017 Local Food Summit
description:
Register at localfoodsummit.org!

Online registration ends at 8 pm Sunday March 19th. 
Day of the event registration will begin at 7:30 am at the EMU Student Center.

The Local Food Summit brings together individuals and organizations that share a common vision for the localized food system of Washtenaw County. The 2017 event utilizes a summit style format, featuring facilitated group discussions that include learning, dialogue, and collective visioning. The summit hopes to engage new audiences as well as long-time participants, including purchasers, chefs, producers, distributors, consumers, educators, business owners, politicians, and local food activists. Attendees will participate in one of six tracks, allowing them to think deeply about a particular aspect of our local food system, and to consider the impacts of racism and policy in Washtenaw County. 

TRACKS
•	Racism and Access to Land and Capital 
•	Farm to Institution
•	Market Development
•	Farm Worker and Labor Justice
•	Current Environmental Issues
•	Food Justice

Cost of Attendance (includes breakfast and lunch)
Early registration (before 3/13) - $40
Registration at the door - $50
Scholarships are available upon request.
